item.description:
Last week we toured the Eel River Preserve but we never got over to the Russell Mill Pond area.  We thought we should try again. Maybe we'll spot the heron again too.

The Eel River Preserve is an award-winning nature preserve very near Myles Standish SF. A recent Boston Globe article reported that "More than 60 acres of wildlife habitat have been restored in Plymouth (at the cost of $2 million)— including the re-creation of a white cedar swamp with dramatic improvements to fish passage, water quality, wetlands, bird migration corridors, and recreational opportunities."  (The picture at right is a red bellied cooter, which reportedly resides at the Eel River Preserve.)

Our walk has been estimated at 4 miles. Please bring water and snacks sufficient for a two hour walk. Bug repellant and sunscreen may be needed too.  

A map is available from the town of Plymouth's web site.

The entrance and parking lot is off Long Pond Road in Plymouth. Boot Pond Road is 2 miles north of the Eastern Entrance of Myles Standish State Forest (Long Pond Road and Alden Road). (And the Preserve is 1.5 miles south of the Exit 5 off Route 3.)
item.how_to_find_us: Parking area at the corner of Long Pond Road and Boot Pond Road

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Part 2 of $2 Million Eel River Preserve & Russell Mill Pond hike
